scheme_name: Scholarship to the Ward of Beneficiary (CBOCWWB)
description: The scheme provides financial assistance in the form of scholarship to the children/wards of workers who are registered under the CBOCWWB on the basis of the percentage of marks obtained in 10th, 12th & Graduation.
benefits: ₹7,500/- (one time) for Graduation or equivalent (from recognized university) with 60% & above
eligibility: The worker/beneficiary should be working in the Establishment, registered under the Punjab Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1965 and his contribution towards labour welfare fund should regularly been received by the Board.

Any worker/beneficiary will be eligible to avail the benefit of the scheme only after 06 months of becoming the beneficiary member of the Chandigarh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board at least for the last six months.
The scholarship application will not be entertained on getting a compartment in any of the subjects.
If any scholarship is granted to the children of the workers from any other institution then he will not be entitled to get a scholarship from the Board.
If any student who placed at 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place in National/International games/sports then he will be granted a scholarship without taking into consideration the percentage of marks.
The scholarship will be given upto two children of the worker.
The applicant should apply for a Scholarship within three months from the date of issue of the mark sheet of the student.
documents: A copy of Aadhaar Card of the applicant
Copy of Aadhaar Card of the nominee
Copy of Aadhaar card of the registered beneficiary worker
Copy of BOCW Card along with validity page
A copy of Aadhaar card of the student
Pass out Certificate/Mark sheets of the previous Class
Worker Bank account details with latest entry/Bank Passbook
